channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
I wouldn't know if the celebs are gone, I was never interested in what they had to tweet, myself.
I learned something about actors only recently. They totally depend on the writing. If you give them a bad script, even great actors suck.

@AriCohn @jeffjarvis @mmasnick @ACLU Let me explain. It's a tweet, with a 280 character limit. Which means what seems "staggeringly incoherent" to you might just be an idea you don't understand.
@AriCohn @jeffjarvis @mmasnick @ACLU We don't know each other, but I'm not stupid, as my friends will (hopefully) tell you, I have strange ideas sometimes, which often turn out to be true. Also disagreeing with someone also isn't a license to be rude.

@biesnecker @TechPRGuy There's more to it than that. I've been reading about slavery all last year and into this year, and it's just like right now. The same people were in charge after the war as before.
@biesnecker @TechPRGuy good guess! ;-)
Russian soldiers refusing to fight in Ukraine. https://t.co/JMVYvO5jZ6
@phonetonote I've got a lot of interop available and more on the way! ;-) https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf
Wordle 328 4/6 üü®‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú üü®‚¨ú‚¨úüü®‚¨ú ‚¨úüü©‚¨ú‚¨úüü® üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©

What are the odds that Musk actually acquires Twitter?
My bet is it's virtually zero.
Why? The difficulties of Twitter have become more apparent, and at the same time, the difficulties of the companies he already controls have gotten bigger with the collapse of the tech stock market.
Owning Twitter is a hobby he can't afford now.
PS: I own a small amount of $TWTR.
Musk shelves $44-billion Twitter deal 'temporarily', shares slump. https://t.co/CsAvaszkh5
‚ÄúPeople you must use on your way up, you might meet up, on your way down.‚Äù https://t.co/JQE877ITq1

1/2 What if Twitter Corp split itself in two. One half operated the network. The servers, the api, the client software. It would sell its services, for a fee, to anyone.
2/2 The other half would own the network you and I use. It would charge for ads, maintain order, testify in congress, negotiate with the EU, and pay the first company to run its servers.
Did you know that the leaders of the biggest insurrection in US history were not punished, remained in the government, and basically got what they wanted, and I‚Äôm not talking about 1/6/21.
There's a new expandIncludes function in the OPML package for JavaScript. https://t.co/RlAhQU3wzt
I think this may be the new RSS manifesto. https://t.co/UZ6iFbcefF
Think of all the places you write and read. Why shouldn't all of them understand RSS, in and out, where ever possible?
@jayrosen_nyu You're absolutely right, I do lament that, all the time. But he isn't CEO yet. Other than speak about it, I don't see that he's done anything.
@johnrobb Yeah that would be something. ;-)
You sure as hell don't run NY, Kyrie. We can't wait for you to leave. https://t.co/KuD2192QXc
Dr Oz is full of crap, but sometimes he's not. https://t.co/sYtknCRU3n

Just guessing that the people who will force people to get abortions are the same people who won't wear a mask to protect others.
In other words, I'm not convinced this has anything to do with principles or religion.
@tfadell @aeroG Thanks for making the iPod and thus helping make podcasts a thing.
The most important EV of the decade? We drive the F-150 Lightning. https://t.co/2s2QJh84R3
